intro: Ormosolenia alpina, commonly known as the alpine ormosolenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Ormosolenia alpina is an important component of alpine ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
